text:
Felix Chen (; 9 July 1942 – 9 April 2018) was a Taiwanese conductor. He was resident conductor and Music Director of the Taipei Symphony Orchestra from 1986 until he resigned in 2003 under "extremely controversial circumstances." Every year Chen and TSO produced one or two operas, such as "Aida", "Otello" or "Turandot", which were major musical events in Taiwan.
Chen died at the age of 75 on 9 April 2018 in Taipei of liver failure.
